justification: During observation trials, participants answered the prompt “How confident do you think the [other person/robot/computer algorithm] was?”, using a slider from 0 (“not confident at all”) to 100 (“very confident”).
“Self-directed metacognition was operationalised as metacognitive efficiency computed via a hierarchical regression model (the RHmeta-d model…).”
At debrief, participants were asked: “How much would you trust the [other participant/robot/computer algorithm] if you were working together?” providing the trustworthiness measure.
Participants rated competence with the item: “How well do you think the [other participant/robot/computer algorithm] did on this task?”

measured_by: choice revision after advice (accept vs. reject)
justification: In Experiment 5, advice-taking was coded behaviourally as 0 for rejecting and 1 for accepting the agent’s advice when participants had the opportunity to revise their initial choice.
